mainheading: Centre’s flagship schemes enter NCERT textbooks
author: Db correspondent
article:
The Union government’s innovative projects like Namami Gange, Digital India, Beti Bachao Beti Padhao and Pradhan Mantri Kaushal Vikas Yojana have made their entry into the new NCERT textbooks for students of Class 6 to 10.

There is a whole chapter dedicated to demonetisation titled ‘Money and Credit’. Swachh Bharat appears in a chapter titled ‘Garbage In, Garbage Out’ of the Class 6 Science book, a  chapter on urban administration in the Political Science book for Class 6 and a chapter on wastewater treatment in the Class 7 Science textbook.

In the first revision after 2007, NCERT has revamped their syllabus with the latest changes in Geography, Science, Political Science, Economics and English textbooks. But however, this is not the first time NCERT has included government schemes in their textbooks. During UPA’s regime, NCERT had included MNREGA, National Food Security Act 2013 and the Right to Information Act in textbooks.

mainheading: Kerala’s new academic calendar has 201 working days
author: Db correspondent
article:
The Education Department of Kerala state has allotted 201 working days on the new academic calendar of 2018-19 aimed at bringing out the best results from SSLC students. According to the calendar, the new academic year will have eight working Saturdays compared to that of six in last years.

Special focus will be on SSLC students to secure A+ in all subjects. As part of this, schools have been directed to scrutinise the performance of the students in the coming model examination of February 2019 with a view to providing special attention to students facing difficulty in any subjects.

Based on the performance students, special training will be provided to the selected students from February 15 -28. All non-curricular activities will be completed by Dec 31st so that students can focus on studies thereafter. The State School Kalolsavam will be held on December 5,6,7,8 and 9 at Alappuzha. The school-level art festivals will be completed by September. The sub-district and district- level festivals will be completed by October and November, respectively.

The State Science Festival will be held from November 9- 11. Only high school and higher secondary school level students will take part in the State level science fair. The state-level ‘Sargotsavam’ will be held from December 27-30.

The annual examinations for classes 1 to 9 will take place in the third week of February and the SSLC, Higher Secondary and Vocational Higher Secondary examinations will take place between March 6 and 25.

mainheading: Kerala’s new academic calendar has 201 working days
author: Db correspondent
article:
The Education Department of Kerala state has allotted 201 working days on the new academic calendar of 2018-19 aimed at bringing out the best results from SSLC students. According to the calendar, the new academic year will have eight working Saturdays compared to that of six in last years.

Special focus will be on SSLC students to secure A+ in all subjects. As part of this, schools have been directed to scrutinise the performance of the students in the coming model examination of February 2019 with a view to providing special attention to students facing difficulty in any subjects.

Based on the performance students, special training will be provided to the selected students from February 15 -28. All non-curricular activities will be completed by Dec 31st so that students can focus on studies thereafter. The State School Kalolsavam will be held on December 5,6,7,8 and 9 at Alappuzha. The school-level art festivals will be completed by September. The sub-district and district- level festivals will be completed by October and November, respectively.

The State Science Festival will be held from November 9- 11. Only high school and higher secondary school level students will take part in the State level science fair. The state-level ‘Sargotsavam’ will be held from December 27-30.

The annual examinations for classes 1 to 9 will take place in the third week of February and the SSLC, Higher Secondary and Vocational Higher Secondary examinations will take place between March 6 and 25.

mainheading: Dengue is Back, Beware!
author: Db correspondent
article:
As monsoon is gathering momentum, Dr Sreedevi, the Ernakulam district Medical Officer has warned against yet another spell of dengue outbreak. According to the notice issued by the Medical Officer, people are advised to keep their houses and the surroundings clean to prevent water stagnation which is vulnerable to Aedes mosquitoes, the carriers of Dengue.

Water collected inside disposed of containers, plastic bottles, tyres, house suspension, and construction sites should be regularly cleaned. In order to follow these precautionary measures, once a week should be marked as ‘Red Day’, the notice says. Health officials, in association with associations of city residents, launched a campaign to remove non-biodegradable waste from house compounds. Civic bodies have also assigned lorries to collect the refuse.

As of now, dengue has claimed 2 lives in the district and 19 cases have been confirmed in June. Twenty-six cases were confirmed in the district last month. The suspected cases were mainly reported from Angamaly, Malayattoor, Puthencruz, Ayyampuzha and Keezhmad.

Fever accompanied by a headache, pain behind the eyes, pain in the limbs could be dengue. Though dengue is curable if detected in the initial stage, it can even be fatal if not detected early. Dengue haemorrhagic fever and dengue shock syndrome are the ones that can cause death. In the case of haemorrhagic fever, there will be blood discharge from the nose, mouth and the gums, low pulse, normal than usual thirst, trouble with breathing, dizziness and black faeces.

mainheading: School Van Accident Claims the Life 3 Kids and Caretaker
author: Db correspondent
article:
In yet another tragedy involving a school van, three children and the caretaker of ‘Kidz World’ play school, Maradu in the outskirts of Kochi after the school van accidentally fell into a temple pond in the area on June 11 afternoon. While two children died on the spot, one succumbed to injuries at a private hospital in Kochi. The deceased children are Adithyan, Carol Joby and Vidyalakshmi and the caretaker Latha Unni. The van was carrying a total of eight children of ‘Kidz World’ at the time of the accident.

The road in the area is very narrow and has no wall or divider separating it from the small but deep temple pond, filled with weeds and water hyacinths. The driver who is reported to be continuing in a critical condition in hospital is charged, for unintentional homicide.

This is the first accident in the new academic year involving school children. Last year in March 2017, two UKG students and a driver were killed, when the vehicle they were travelling, rammed against a mud wall at Koothattukulam. In June 2015, a tree crushed a school bus at Kothamangalam in which five children were killed. In September 2011 five children were killed when a van carrying around 25 school students plunged into a canal at Channankara near Thiruvananthapuram.

mainheading: Kindergarten school registration made mandatory
author: Db correspondent
article:
In the wake of the tragic school van accident that killed 3 kids and a caretaker, all kindergarten schools in the state are required to get themselves registered before July 13 according to an order of the district collector. The pre-schools are required to submit information on the staff working, number of children studying, working hours, mode of transportation and basic facilities provided to the children.

As part of Disaster Management law, the registration has been made mandatory to ensure the safety of children while linking parents, teachers and the pre-school during an accident. All vehicles transporting children to school are required to have a safety sticker provided by the Motor Vehicles Department before June 20. The department is authorised to issue clearance to the vehicles based on driver’s experience and the vehicle’s fitness after examining all the related documents.

Vehicles found without the sticker after the scheduled date will be severely punished. The vehicle safety sticker is mandatory for all vehicles of educational institutions from kindergarten school to professional colleges and special schools.

Motor Vehicles Department and the Police will club with all educational institutions to spread awareness among parents and teachers about the need for safe transportation of the school children. As of now, under Muvattupuzha RTO, 640 vehicles have been certified with the safety sticker. Under Ernakulam RTO, 2123 school vehicles have been certified.

mainheading: Kochi gearing up to change the face of India
author: Db correspondent
article:
The recent discovery of abundant hydrate gas resources in coastal Kochi, ‘Queen of the Arabian Sea’ is likely to change the face of India in the coming years. A recent survey conducted by the American Geological Survey found that the Indian coasts of Kochi, Krishna-Godavari basin and Cauvery basin have almost 130 million cubic feet hydrate gas reserves which would be sufficient enough to meet the energy requirements of the country for the next 300 years.

The survey also noted that, of the total gas accumulation, one-third of the reserve is found in the waters of Kochi, which is claimed to be the largest ‘Natural Gas Reserve’ till date. But the depressing fact is that India does not have the required advanced technology to extract the hydrate gas.

Natural gas hydrates are a naturally occurring, an ice-like combination of natural gas and water found in oceans and polar regions, which can be used as a  fuel. Growing energy demand, climate concerns, and a desire to shift towards cleaner fossil fuels have pushed the need for Natural Gas Hydrate as a potential energy resource for the future. However, producing it and effectively converting the same into energy in an environmentally safe manner continues to be a significant challenge.

mainheading: ‘Hello English’ to improve communication skills
author: Db correspondent
article:
With the aim of helping students improve their English communicative skills, the Education Department has rolled out “Hello English” programme for students of class 1 to 7 across Ernakulam.

Concerned teachers are being given proper training under the programme started on June 20. With the aid of advanced technology, the trainers help students to develop their creative writing skills. Classroom libraries are being developed to help children to improve their reading skills. Special focus is being given to physically-challenged students. Two periods in a week of the regular school timetable are dedicated to ‘Hello English’ programme.

A district-level monitoring committee headed by a programme coordinator for each district is in charge of the programme. The committee will coordinate and monitor the effective conduct of the programme.

mainheading: Malayalam Learning Programme for Migrant Labourers
author: Db correspondent
article:
‘Changathi’ the state government’s Malayalam literacy programme aimed at helping the migrant labourers integrate and communicate with the local public, proved to be a hit as 469 labourers passed the literacy examination held on May 13.

When Due to the highest concentration of migrant workers 604 people attended the programme, 503 candidates appeared for the exam and 469 people passed the test. The programme was launched in Perumbavoor on August 15, 2017, due to the highest concentration of migrant worker there. The programme was inaugurated by the state education Minister C Raveendranath.

A textbook called 'Hamari Malayalam' was brought out to teach the migrant labourers. The 25 chapters of the book cover various topics such as health, hygiene, banking, human rights and ethical values.

Initially, a survey was conducted in 27 wards of Perumbavoor to identify the recipients. Five social workers and students from MES College, Marampally were assigned as instructors. The classes were held on all Sundays at 10 factories, a madrassa and the Perumbavoor municipality’s cultural centre.

mainheading: Child helpline desk at Ernakulam South Railway Station
author: Db correspondent
article:
The Ernakulam south railway station has set up a child helpline desk to help innocent children from unwanted exploitation. The helpline desk was inaugurated the Ernakulam district collector, Mohammed Y Safirulla on Thursday, June 7. On the occasion, he hoped that the desk will be helpful in nabbing people who exploit children for their benefits.

Helpline desk was launched at the railway station to help lost or children travelling alone on board trains. They are usually the victims of child trafficking or child labour. The desk will ensure that the children are protected by providing them with legal help.

Under the leadership of the collector, the District administration along with Women and Child Development authority and the Railways will ensure the safety of children. Child helpline will ensure lost children are found, apart from providing the necessary legal protection to children arriving at the station being part of child labour from across the country.

Since the district has the highest number of migrant workers from other states, there is an increasing number of child labour cases. The helpline desk hopes to join with the common public to protect these children and provide basic education to these children. The collector, during his inaugural speech, expressed his wish to launch a booth at North station as well. Anyone can contact the helpline desk at 1098 or report directly to the helpline booth.

mainheading: Kabaddi Masters Dubai 2018: All you need to know
author: Db correspondent
article:
Kabaddi Masters tournament hosted by Kabaddi Masters Dubai was a nine-day action-packed sports event from June 22-June 30, showcasing this game of Indian origin to foreign lands. Though the game got its first exposure beyond the Indian borders in the 1963 Berlin Olympics, the Dubai tournament provided a wider arena for the game to spread its wings further.

Besides India and Pakistan, the tournament had participants from South Korea, Iran, Argentina and Kenya. The six teams were divided into two groups of three. The teams in each group played two matches against every other team in their respective group, with the top two teams from each group qualifying for the semi-finals.

Group A: India, Pakistan, Kenya

Group B: Iran, South Korea, Argentina

The opening encounter of the tournament was between arch-rivals India and Pakistan, the first tussle between these two teams since the 2016 Kabaddi World cup. India thrashed Pakistan 36-20 in the opening match. The inaugural edition of the Dubai Kabaddi Masters was organised by the International Kabaddi Federation along with the Dubai Sports Council and with Star India network. 

The game is said to have its inception in the southern state of Tamil Nadu, India. Kabaddi is played between two teams of seven players; the object of the game is for a single player on offence, referred to as a "raider", to run into the half area of the opposing team's court, tag out as many of their defenders as possible, and return to their own half of the court, all without being tackled by the defenders. Points are scored for each player tagged by the raider, while the opposing team earns a point for stopping the raider.

mainheading: Celebrity Gorilla Well-versed in Sign Language Dies
author: Db correspondent
article:
Do you know Koko? If you don’t, do know her. But by the time you start to love her, you would be shocked to know that she is no more. The gorilla who found a way into people’s heart on account of her unique ability to communicate in sign language died on June 20 in California at the age of 46.

The ‘celebrity’ gorilla, who learnt sign language to communicate with humans died in her sleep, confirmed The Gorilla Foundation, a non-profit organization responsible for taking care of the primate. Initially named Hanabi-ko meaning fireworks, she was taught sign language by a researcher, Dr Francine Patterson. Koko understood almost 2,000 words of English. The first symbols that Patterson taught Koko were signs for "eat," "drink" and "more," and over the years, Koko accumulated hundreds of words that she could combine into phrases using signs

Of the English language taught to her, Koko had a few choices of words which were incorporated into a song about climate change titled "Man Stupid," created in collaboration with the Laurel Canyon Animal Company and posted on YouTube in January 2017.

Koko also had many celebrity friends who used visited her in her captivity. Koko met Flea, the bassist in the Red Hot Chill Peppers, and the actor Betty White. She was quite close to actor and comedian Robin Williams. It was reported that Koko was “quiet and very thoughtful” when told of Williams’ death.

Koko was so popular that she appeared on the cover of National Geographic with a picture that the female primate took of herself in a mirror. She is survived by her partner, a male named Ndume.

mainheading: NASA Plans to keep Earth Safe from Asteroids
author: Db correspondent
article:
Stop worrying that an asteroid hit would wipe out all life from Earth. The good news is that NASA, White House and the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) are at your rescue.

The "National Near-Earth Object Preparedness Strategy and Action Plan (NEO)" outlines the steps that the team would take over the next decade to prevent and prepare for any dangerous asteroid strikes on Earth.

The plan details out five ways to prepare for a hit. It includes detecting, tracking, and more effective decision-making, increasing international cooperation with the objective of preparing the rest of the world, and coming up with a plan of emergency procedures if they found an asteroid heading towards the Earth.

Goals

The first goal is to enhance Near-Earth Object (NEO) detection, tracking, and characterization capabilities, in order to increase the response time in the US. and all of Earth. Though asteroid pieces, more than 100 tonnes, bombard the Earth daily, most disintegrate before hitting the surface of our planet.

The NASA dreams to develop technologies for future deflection and disruption missions and the NASA team visions to “increase international cooperation on NEO preparation.”  It also plans to routinely run through NEO impact procedures, including practising the action steps with foreign governments.

mainheading: Were Humans at the Verge of Extinction once?
author: Db correspondent
article:
Genetic variations in human population not only arises from genetic variations, but also from cultural or social changes. A recent study in the world of genetics reveals that humans nearly caused the extinction of mankind in the Neolithic Age.

Researchers believe 7,000 years ago fighting among patrilineal (father’s line) clans led to the sudden choke in human diversity. The Neolithic Y-chromosome bottleneck, as it is called, has puzzled anthropologists and biologists since it was first discovered in 2015. Across Africa, Europe and Asia, the Y chromosome passed on from father to son, collapsed, such that there was only one man for every 17 women.

Stanford University researchers argue that “competition between patrilineal kin groups” also called tribalism, led to this gene collapse. They point out that, within a clan, women could have married into new clans, while men stayed with their own clans their entire lives. This would mean that, within the clan, Y chromosome variation is limited.

Later on, brutal warfare between clans could have wiped out many clans, along with their particular type of Y-chromosome. Those clans successful in warfare grew wealthy and powerful. The monarch and his sons had exclusive mating rights as they could have many wives and mistresses thus diminishing the genetic diversity of our species.

According to the researcher’s data, the warfare would have been brutal that it killed one-twentieth of the entire male population. So it is believed that the first civilization rose from ashes.?

mainheading: KSRTC Launches Electric Buses
author: Db correspondent
article:
Kerala’s public transport system, KSRTC, has launched electric buses in the state on June 18 thereby Kerala becoming the sixth state in the to have such with the public service. The trial service lasted for 15 days, starting with eight days in Thiruvananthapuram and following seven days in Ernakulam.

Education Minister C Raveendranath flagged off the e-bus after a function held at Vytilla Mobility Hub on June 23. C Raveendranath, MLA,  PT Thomas and MP K V Thomas also travelled in the electric bus on its maiden trip.

In Kochi, eight services are scheduled for the electric bus starting from Aluva at 6.30 am and ending at the same place by 8.35 pm. The bus will be plying to Fort Kochi, Infopark, Paravoor, Nedumbassery Airport and Aroor covering 292 km daily.

On June 27, the bus will move to Kozhikode for its trial run there. The bus is built by Hyderabad-based Gold Stone Infratech which is providing it free of cost for the trial run. Low-floored and air-conditioned, the bus can seat up to 35 passengers and has a wheel-chair facility. It has a wall-mounted lithium-iron BYD Goldstone FE battery which gets fully-charged in about four hours and can travel up to 350 kilometres.

For the trial run, the KSRTC has priced its tickets on par with what is being charged in its air-conditioned Volvo buses.  As of 2016, the state-run corporation has more than 600 low-floor A/C and non-A/C buses in its fleet.

mainheading: Kerala Blasters Gearing up to Challenge European Clubs
author: Db correspondent
article:
Indian Super League’s (ISL) strong team, Kerala Blasters will be seen playing a pre-season friendly match against A-League club Melbourne City FC and La Liga club Girona in July at the Kochi’s own famed Jawaharlal Nehru stadium.

After the Delhi based franchise? had played a friendly match against Premier League club West Bromwich Albion in 2016, Kochi Blasters will be the second team of ISL to play against European Club.

The club coached under David James ended ISL 2018 coming 6th, thus missing out on a chance to participate in the finals. The Kerala Blasters also participated in the Super Cup, being eliminated in the first round by NEROCA.

Kerala Blasters FC had strengthened their defences with the signing of young defender Abdul Hakku Nediyodath. The youngster follows Anas Edathodika as Kerala second defensive signing in the last ten days. So far, Kerala Blasters have brought in Indian internationals such as Holicharan Narzary and Anas Edathodika, while signing young prospects such as Dheeraj Singh and now, Abdul Hakku Nediyodath.

Girona FC had qualified for the La Liga last season for the very first time in their 87-year-old history. In their maiden season, they finished 10th in the league. Their biggest achievement last year was beating Champions League winners Real Madrid 2-1.

mainheading: Reading day celebrated with books and colour
author: Db correspondent
article:
As part of this year’s Vaayanadinam (Day of Reading) celebrated every year on June 19, various events were conducted in different parts of the state commemorating the contributions of late P N Panicker who devoted his life to the cause of encouraging reading habit. Ernakulam district level celebration was inaugurated at SNV HSS, Paravoor.

The program was organized jointly by the Information and Public Relations Department and the District Library Council and Public Education Departments. Students took part in a book procession organised as part of the inaugural ceremony. Books were gifted to the guests who attended the program in cloth bags. 

The Aluva Taluk Staff Welfare Committee conducted an event, ‘Smaranika Dhyuthi’ to honour the contributions of P N Panicker. The event was inaugurated by district collector Mohammed Y Safirullah.

‘PN Panicker who initiated universal literacy movement in the state is considered as ‘the one man soldier of the reading world’ said Sethu. “Kerala was able to achieve 100% literacy rate due to the increase. In terms of reading, the state is a role model to the world as no other state or country has village libraries. There are 7000 libraries in the state. The government gives salary to all the librarians. Some of the libraries are 60 or 50 years old. PN Panicker is the man who initiated this reading trend,” recalled Sethu.

PN Panicker is the one who formed Thiruvithaamkoor Granthasala Sangham (Travancore Library Association) in 1945 with 47 rural libraries, encouraging everyone to 'Read and Grow'. He travelled through the villages of Kerala proclaiming the value of reading. He succeeded in bringing some 6,000 libraries into this network. Grandhasala Sangham won the prestigious ‘Krupsakaya Award’ from UNESCO in 1975.

mainheading: Kerala Floods 2018: Kuttanad struggles to pick up pace after floods
author: Db correspondent
article:
Though floods are not new to Kuttanad, as it lies 2.2 metres below sea level, this year’s monsoon along with the heavy inflow from the rivers of the highlands resulted in a massive deluge in ‘Kerala’s granary’. The floodwaters from the mountain ranges in the East resulting in overflowing of the rivers, Pampa, Achankovil, Manimala, Meenachal and Muvattupuzha displaced around two lakh people from their houses, presenting a nightmare to Kuttanad.

Kainakiri panchayath of Kuttanad was worst affected. Even when the water level in the rivers began receding, water from other areas flowed into Kainakiri as it is the lowest lying area. There are 5,579 houses in the panchayat, and people of the 15 wards in the panchayat had to be housed in 10 relief camps.

For several days, Kuttanad remained in the dark, with its residents continuing in camps set up in Allapuzha and Kottayam even as people in many other affected areas moved to their battered homes. As most houses in Kuttanad are situated amid paddy fields and backwaters, everyone had to be evacuated when the waters began rising.

Official statistics state that 8,500 hectares of paddy cultivation and 80% of livestock has perished. Kuttanad’s major source of income is dependent on backwater fishing, paddy cultivation and tourism. The devastating floods had hit the houseboat and resort tourism as well. Top rated resorts in the area were completely inundated in this monsoon.

After the flood-induced vacation, 116 schools in Kuttanad reopened on September 3. The education department had made arrangements to provide study materials lost in the flood.

mainheading: Move to integrate school education under a single agency
author: Db correspondent
article:
Union Human Resource Development Minister Prakash Javedkar has launched SamagraShiksha scheme with a view to improving the quality and focus of education by unifying all existing projects under one umbrella and instructed all state government to follow the same.

Samagra Shiksha is a school education project introduced by the central government of India to absorb  SarvaShikshaAbhiyan (SSA), RashtriyaMadhyamikShikshaAbhiyan (RMSA) and Teacher Education under one umbrella. The scheme aims to provide a holistic development of education and inculcate digital technology into education through smart classrooms and digital boards by unifying all levels of education pre-school to Class 12.

Radical changes

The scheme will be in effect from the current academic year and is mutually undertaken by the central and state governments with plans to radically improve the infrastructure and quality of teaching.

State Council of Educational Research and Training (SCERT), the state agency responsible for the educational programs in Kerala has also announced the plans to integrate SSLC and Higher Secondary examinations under a unified system following SamagraShiksha.

The project will also merge the Directorate of Public Instruction, Higher Secondary Directorate and VHSE to transform the educational system in the state. As all agencies follow different systems of administration, the state government has appointed a committee for the smooth integration of management from different directorates.

As a centrally sponsored scheme implemented through a single State Implementation Society (SIS) at the State/UT level. At the national level, there would be a governing council headed by Minister of Human Resource Development and a Project Approval Board (PAB) headed by Secretary, Department of School Education and Literacy.

mainheading: Why Abhilash Tomy is the talk of the town?
author: Db correspondent
article:
Abhilash Tomy is a celebrated sailor from India who is also a pilot in the Indian Navy. As part of the International solo circumnavigation Golden Globe Race, he set sail on July 1. While taking part in the competition, his yacht, ‘Thuriya’ mast collapsed in a rough storm in the remote southern Indian Ocean on September 21.

Due to rough weather, Thuriyagot tossed in the face of high tides before stabilising. Tomy texted through satellite-based device requesting for evacuation stating his back has been injured and he is unable to move. The sailor in distress was spotted by the Indian Navy Reconnaissance aircraft and has been rescued by French vessel Osiris on September 24.

It may be noted that Tomy is the first Indian and second Asian to complete a solo non-stop circumnavigation around the world on a boat that began on November 1, 2012, and ended on March 31, 2013.

GOLDEN GLOBE RACE 2018

The 2018 Golden Globe Race is a sailing race around the world which started on 1 July 2018 with 18 sailors who do not have any outside assistance from Les Sables-d'Olonne, France. The race organised after the fifty years existence of Sunday Times Golden Globe Race, allows yachts similar to those used at that time, with no modern technology permitted. The entrants belonged to 13 different countries. Out of them, six have chosen the class compliant but relatively modern yacht called Rustler 36.

mainheading: Proud moment! CIAL bags UN’s environment award
author: Db Correspondent
article:
World’s first solar airport, Cochin International Airport Ltd (CIAL) has bagged the United Nation's highest environmental accolade, ‘Champion of the Earth’ award (2018). The award was presented on the sidelines of the UN general assembly in New York on September 26.

The UN environment executive director Erik Solheim informed CIAL MD VJ Kurien through a letter which read, “This is the UN's highest environmental accolade and it reflects your leadership in the use of sustainable energy.”

Solheim and his UN team had visited the international airport earlier this year to applaud on the use of solar energy to meet the airport’s needs, calling it a leading example among global airports.

In 2005, the UN established the ‘Champions of the Earth’ awards to honour environmental leaders of society.

The award is the United Nations highest environmental honour recognizing visionary people and organisations all over the world that exemplify leadership and advocate action on sustainable development, climate change and a life of dignity for all. The award supports this process by illustrating, through the examples of the laureates, that the transition to a low-carbon, resource-efficient, inclusive and sustainable world is not just possible, but already in progress.

mainheading: Renowned filmmaker Shaison talks to students at St. Albert’s HSS
author: Db correspondent
article:
Renowned filmmaker Shaison talks to students at St.Albert’s HSS

St.Albert’s HSS Ernakulam had a wonderful occasion when the renowned documentary filmmaker, editor and cameraman, Shaison P Ouseph visited the school last day. The programme starts with the welcome speech by School Captain proceeded with a seminar on “Mass media and Youth” by the English club of the school. During the seminar, Shaison shared his experience in photography to a group consisting of 100 club members. The crowd was facilitated with different aspects of photography and frames. Slide presentation of famous photographs turned out to be an inspiration for the children. The session turned out to be a great learning opportunity for students and teachers.

He also urged them to come up with the art exhibitions, workshops, theatre, musical events and many other cultural events according to their taste. He also suggested them to have a glance at highly innovative programmes like the Kochi Muziris Biennale.

His video presentation showcased his public service campaigns promoting literacy, women empowerment and against child exploitations which had won him many national and international accolades including United Nations International Labour Organization and US Embassy awards. The General Manager, Rev.Fr. Michael Dcruz and HM, N J Francis was present during the auspicious event.

mainheading: ISRO's GSAT-7A brings strategic boost for Indian Air Force
author: Db Correspondent
article:
ISRO launches its 35th communication satellite nicknamed ‘Angry Bird’ and the 13th flight of GSLV rocket to Earth’s orbit on December 20, 2018, from Andhra Pradesh’s Sriharikota. GSAT-7A will give a boost to the strategic communication and networking capabilities of the Indian Air Force.


Know GSAT-7A and its launch

·         ISRO’s GSLV-F11 launched communication satellite GSAT-7A from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Sriharikota at 4.10pm on December 20, 2018.

·         GSLV-F11 is the 7th flight carrying a satellite to outer space and this is the 7th launch from the space station in 2018.

·         The 2,250 kg GSAT-7A has a life span of eight years.

·         This is the 39th Indian communications satellite which will provide a secure mode of communication, exclusively to be used by Indian Air Force.

mainheading: Bees just need 4 brain cells to count!
author: Db Correspondent
article:
Having minimal nerve cells in their brain, bees showed immense intelligence in counting with small numbers. To understand their counting ability, the researchers of the Queen Mary University of London reconstructed a very simple miniature 'brain' on a computer with just four nerve cells, a number fewer than the number a real bee has.

The result of the experiment

Researchers found that the simulated ‘brain’ could count accurately small numbers when closely inspecting, the same way bees count. The result showed that the clever counting behaviour of bees makes complex mathematical counting much easier, proving that bees have impressive cognitive abilities with limited brain power.

Earlier experiments

Previous studies had already proved that bees could count up to a maximum of five items when putting on display. Brain size matters a lot when it comes to bees. As they have to implement efficient computational algorithms to solve mathematical counting with only one million nerve cells in total.

article:

mainheading: For the first time ever a spacecraft lands on the far side of the moon
subheading: The Chinese lunar exploration mission, Chang'e-4, successfully soft-landed its lunar rover into the darker hemisphere of moon's surface for the first time ever in history. So far humans have made 6 manned and 17 robotic successful landings on our natural satellite but were all on the visible hemisphere. Thus the Chinese exploration could be a game changer for human enquiry into the mysteries of our universe.
author: Db correspondent
article:
On Thursday, with much surprise to the scientific community around the world, Chinese space agency CNSA announced the successful landing of its lunar rover under the mission Chang'e-4 on the far side of the moon at around 4.00 am (IST) January 03, 2019. Though the vehicle is no better than any other lunar rover, the mission is expected to dig deep into mysteries of the origin of moon, earth or may even the solar system itself as the region with so many geological peculiarities has never been explored before. 

The robotic spacecraft which landed on the Aitken Basin of the moon was launched on December 07, 2018 and entered the orbit of the moon on December 12, 2018. Aitken Basin is the largest known impact crater in the entire solar system situated in the lunar south pole. With a diameter of 25000 km and a depth of 13 km, the giant circular depression which exposed the lunar crust and even the mantle might have caused due to an ancient collision. The site is a perfect place to study the changes happened on the face of the moon. 

The far side of the moon is the hemisphere of the moon that always faces away from earth and is not observable from our planet. Due to a phenomenon called tidal locking the same side of the moon is always facing the earth known as the near side of the earth. Because of which the other side came to know as the far side of the earth. 

The spacecraft named after the Chinese moon goddess, Chang'e-4 started sending photographs of the far side of moon via Queqiao, a rely satellite launched on May 20, 2018, ahead of the lunar mission, as no communication is possible to earth from the far side of the moon. 

The lunar mission will also be a boost to human inhabitants to colonize moon as it contains a small biosphere with symbiotic life forms such as cotton, rapeseed, potato, fruit fly, yeast and rockcress. The test is to find if plants could perform photosynthesis and respiration in the lunar surface.
